src.main.java.com.fewstera.injectablemedicinesguide.util
[Java] Class SystemUiHider

java.lang.Object
  src.main.java.com.fewstera.injectablemedicinesguide.util.SystemUiHider

public abstract class SystemUiHider

A utility class that helps with showing and hiding system UI such as the status bar and navigation/system bar. This class uses backward-compatibility techniques described in Creating Backward-Compatible UIs to ensure that devices running any version of ndroid OS are supported. More specifically, there are separate implementations of this abstract class: for newer devices, getInstance will return a SystemUiHiderHoneycomb instance, while on older devices getInstance will return a SystemUiHiderBase instance.

For more on system bars, see System Bars.

See Also:
android.view.View#setSystemUiVisibility(int)
android.view.WindowManager.LayoutParams#FLAG_FULLSCREEN

Nested Class Summary
interface SystemUiHider.OnVisibilityChangeListener

A callback interface used to listen for system UI visibility changes.

Field Detail

FLAG_FULLSCREEN

public static final int FLAG_FULLSCREEN
When this flag is set, show() and hide() will toggle the visibility of the status bar. If there is a navigation bar, show and hide will toggle low profile mode.

FLAG_HIDE_NAVIGATION

public static final int FLAG_HIDE_NAVIGATION
When this flag is set, show() and hide() will toggle the visibility of the navigation bar, if it's present on the device and the device allows hiding it. In cases where the navigation bar is present but cannot be hidden, show and hide will toggle low profile mode.

FLAG_LAYOUT_IN_SCREEN_OLDER_DEVICES

public static final int FLAG_LAYOUT_IN_SCREEN_OLDER_DEVICES
When this flag is set, the android.view.WindowManager.LayoutParams#FLAG_LAYOUT_IN_SCREEN flag will be set on older devices, making the status bar "float" on top of the activity layout. This is most useful when there are no controls at the top of the activity layout.

This flag isn't used on newer devices because the action bar, the most important structural element of an Android app, should be visible and not obscured by the system UI.

Constructor Detail

SystemUiHider

protected SystemUiHider(Activity activity, View anchorView, int flags)

 
Method Detail

getInstance

public static SystemUiHider getInstance(Activity activity, View anchorView, int flags)
Creates and returns an instance of SystemUiHider that is appropriate for this device. The object will be either a SystemUiHiderBase or SystemUiHiderHoneycomb depending on the device.
Parameters:
activity - The activity whose window's system UI should be controlled by this class.
anchorView - The view on which View#setSystemUiVisibility(int)#setSystemUiVisibility(int) will be called.
flags - Either 0 or any combination of FLAG_FULLSCREEN, FLAG_HIDE_NAVIGATION, and FLAG_LAYOUT_IN_SCREEN_OLDER_DEVICES.
